oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Einfluss von Fruchtfolgen zur Biomasseproduktion und Gärreste-Düngung auf Bodenstruktur und mikrobielle Aktivität
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reents, Hans Jürgen
Stollovsky, Moritz
Forster, Felix
Lang, Toni
Bauer, Simon
Brandhuber, Robert
Beck, Robert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Crop combinations and interactions
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Soil
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a field experiment with five different main crop rotations and fives subtypes for organic biogas systems, aggregate stability, organic carbon, total nitrogen and catalase were evaluated in the topsoil layer in spring 2010, 2011 and 2013 in a winter wheat stand. Aggregate stability was enhanced by variation of crop rotation but not on manuring with biogas slurry. Rotations with a higher percentage of legumes led to a higher aggregate stability. On the other hand catalase activity was improved by biogas slurry.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Reents, Hans Jürgen; Stollovsky, Moritz; Forster, Felix; Lang, Toni; Bauer, Simon; Brandhuber, Robert and Beck, Robert (2014) Einfluss von Fruchtfolgen zur Biomasseproduktion und Gärreste-Düngung auf Bodenstruktur und mikrobielle Aktivität. Paper at: 13. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Hochschule für nachhaltige Entwicklung Eberswalde, 17. - 20. März 2015.
